summary: The Veterans Health Administration may spend more than $1 billion in fiscal 2018 for non-recurring maintenance and minor construction projects among its 1,240 medical facilities. This work includes projects such as new parking garages or clinical buildings, as well as roof and road maintenance. We found VHA's guidance for preparing project cost estimates could be improved to help it formulate more realistic budget estimates. We...
title: VA Construction: Management of Minor Construction and Non-Recurring Maintenance Programs Could Be Improved
